bioghist.p: The Walt Whitman Bridge is a suspension bridge spanning the Delaware River from Philadelphia to Gloucester City, New Jersey. The Walt Whitman Bridge is one of the larger bridges on the east coast of the United States. Construction on the bridge began in 1953, and it opened to traffic on May 16, 1957. The name was bestowed on July 20, 1955. The naming of the bridge itself was a subject of controversy. While the span was still under construction, the Catholic Diocese of Camden and local officials in South Jersey led a letter-writing campaign against the naming of the bridge after Whitman because of his homosexuality.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters and postcards sent to the Delaware River Port Authority (DRPA) regarding the naming of the Walt Whitman Bridge. The collection also includes minutes and summary reports of the special committee designated DRPA to consider names for the bridge.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
